page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content: EDUCATION - BODELWYDDAN CASTLE This is situated in the parkland adjoining the area under discussion but the Castle itself comes into the given area. In 1984 the Castle was purchased by Clwyd County Council as an education establishment. The last previous owner had run an independent boarding school for girls at the Castle which was then known as Lowther College. The main purpose of the Clwyd County Council is to run the place as a centre for computer technology amongst other things. Local comprehensive schools are encouraged to use it for their fifth and sixth formers to further their knnowledge in computer science. Some of these courses are residential. Specialist staff have been engaged to teach at the centre.
